name: Premier Inn Newcastle - Team Valley

reviews.text: 3rd time I have stayed here this time with my mum, 2 aunties and sister-in-law for a family get together and to do some shopping at the Metro Centre.
reviews.title: Excellent stay - staff could not have been more helpful

reviews.text: The reception staff were very welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them. The same with the restaurant and bar staff.
reviews.title: Great location for metro centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room very large and clean, twins have 2 double beds which are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Naked guy at the door at 4am !

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant in the evening and could not fault the food or the breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: Team Valley Premier Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were due to check out on the Saturday at 12.00noon however one of my auties was unwell in the night (not the food) and was unable to travel. Michelle on reception could not be more accommodating, she arranged for my auntie to have a late check out and also asked if there was anything else she required (toast, tea etc). This was fantastic service which was above and beyond. Special thanks to Michelle as she also arranged for the domestic staff not to disturb my auntie whilst she slept.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: As always very nice staff.
reviews.title: A nice evening stay

reviews.text: One bonus was that the receptionist offered two room cards, one to gain access to the room and the other to keep in the slot on the wall to keep the power on to ensure the room remained warm. Having spent two nights at two other premier inn this week, and been cold, this was an unprompted offer and well received. Food was standard issue premier inn fayre, pleasant enough and reasonable value for money.
reviews.title: Family visit to Newcastle

reviews.text: Great standard of rooms and the breakfasts are MUCH better than Travelodge, which is the budget chain we usually choose. However, my wife does like a bath, and there were only showers in the rooms - but it is a GREAT shower! The breakfast buffet uses very good ingredients, and they are cooked well. For this reason aloe, I'd be happy to go back to a Premier Inn. However, the mattress really spoilt our sleep - just a bit too lumpy.
reviews.title: Great for business stays

reviews.text: I chose this hotel for convenience of its location. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Room was clean and spacious and perfect for a business stay.
reviews.title: A comfortable and relaxing stay

reviews.text: If you want to eat out then you need to take a taxi or drive as the hotel is on the team valley business estate and not in town. However the hotel restaurant has a good menu and is reasonably priced. The wifi was a bit of a nightmare to login to and kept connected. Can Premier Inn not just charge an extra £3 per night (cost of 24hr wifi) as standard??
reviews.title: Not at all bad

reviews.text: Booked this hotel for £19 for a trip to Newcastle to meet friends. We have stayed in the hotel before and experienced the same level of customer care as before. All staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good location

reviews.text: We stayed in room 217 (family room), which was very spacious but without a bath.
reviews.title: Great night's sleep

reviews.text: We would recommend this to other people looking for a good hotel and we didn't mind staying away from the centre as we know the area well. The fact that it's just off the A1 within Team Valley make it easier to check out and travel home without having to battle through a city centre.
reviews.title: First time at a Premier Inn, hopefully not the last

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night with a coach load of ladies on a shopping trip to the Metro Centre and Newcastle.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel
Great inn!
reviews.text: It is a short drive from the Metro centre and was an ideal base for us. The reception and lounge bar area is an ideal area to relax and we found the staff friendly and helpful when we needed to book a taxi to go out for dinner. They have a good restaurant but we only ate breakfast there. Breakfast was varied and plentiful amd good quality. Worth the money.

Booked this premier inn as a treat for my daughter . Stayed here before with a friend love the location and the staff . We had the meal deal (evening meal and breakfast ) well worth the money 3 courses for evening meal plus drink then full buffet breakfast eat as much as you like , The rooms are gorgeous spotlessly clean and comfortable very relaxing cannot fault anything at all love love premier inns
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: After arriving I realised when I booked online I had made a typo and actually booked to stay in November rather than October after a rather red face the receptionist refunded my booking and got me a room, the room was spacious and clean , the restaurant was not too busy and choice of food good, staff were very friendly and although I only stayed overnight Will stay here again and recommend to anyone
reviews.title: A great hotel to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can certainly recommend this Premier Inn. We stayed for just one night but our experience was a very good one. Our room was clean and comfortable and we received a very warm welcome from the friendly and efficient Reception staff. We have stayed in more expensive hotels and not had such good accommodation. We had a great night's sleep - no noise interference as can sometimes be the case in a city weekend stay.
reviews.title: Great value! Great accommodation! Great service!

reviews.text: Stayed last night at the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent quality

reviews.text: Lovely service from friendly staff
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

aka: Premier Inn Newcastle (Team Valley) Hotel Gateshead
